sentence: Honor Pennsylvania, “Greatest Hits.” The PAC wars keep escalating between allies of TV personality Mehmet Oz and former Treasury official David McCormick, the two biggest-spending Republicans running for U.S. Senate.
title: The Trailer: In Texas, Republicans battle for room on the right

sentence: Down the Ballot WEEKEND UPDATE — “How Orlando became the center of the universe for GOP Senate hopefuls,” by Natalie Allison, POLITICO: “Mehmet Oz has less than 90 days left before Pennsylvania Republican voters cast their ballots in one of the most contentious Senate primaries in the nation.
title: 6 House races to watch in Texas

sentence: Dr. Mehmet Oz is a heart surgeon, professor emeritus at Columbia University and Republican candidate for the U.S. Senate in Pennsylvania.
author: Dr. Mehmet Oz
title: Dr. Oz: Follow The Science For Domestic Energy Policy
Oz Vows to Renounce Turkish Citizenship If Elected Senator

sentence: HARRISBURG, Pa. — Mehmet Oz, warding off criticism from a key rival in Pennsylvania’s heated Republican primary race for U.S. Senate, said Wednesday that he will renounce his dual citizenship in Turkey if he is elected, as the expensive campaign took on a harder and more personal edge.
author: Marc Levy
title: Dr. Oz vows to renounce Turkish citizenship if elected senator
